result.execSummary:
The defendant Tessa E Goulais was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (2nd w/ Pass), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: To be paid at the rate of $50.00 per month commencing February 1, 2016 and each 1st of the month thereafter until paid in full.  There is a $15 administrative fee for any payment plan and any change to a payment plan. The fee will be added to the first payment. If not paid, a judgment shall be entered.

With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.
Effective upon licensure.  Attached is an information sheet for the defendant regarding installation.

Defendant shall undergo an AODA assessment and safety plan.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample and make arrangements within three days with the Washington County Sheriff's Department to provide the sample.

Def in person & by Atty Patricia M. Padurean.  Atty Mandy A. Schepper appeared for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Guilty plea entered to Count 2,  Court dismissed Count 1 for read-in.  Statements by counsel and defendant.   Court finds def guilty on Count 2 and enters judgment.

Reset Plea from 12-18-15 to Plea/sentencing hearing on 01-04-2016 at 02:30 pm at counsel's request to coincide with school break.
